attributes.action: Calling for a Parliamentary vote on the EU referendum
attributes.additional_details:
Given the financial implications of Brexit, pound devaluation, lies by the Leave campaign and number of people who regretted voting 'leave' as a result, public vote should be treated as advisory only.

'Leave' campaign misused facts, being intentionally deceptive. The sheer fact Nissan is taking legal action against them shows the extend of their deception and propaganda. 

Our prosperity as a nation and future of the younger generation should not be shaped by lies and cheap thrills.
attributes.background:
The outcome of the EU referendum is not legally binding and can be overwritten by Parliament until Article 50 is evoked.

Given the economic turmoil caused by Brexit vote, Parliament has an obligation to impartially evaluate whether public has made the right decision and have a final educated say.
